definition: to flow/to disseminate/to circulate or spread/to move or drift/to degenerate/to banish or send into exile/stream of water or sth resembling one/class, rate or grade
to pass on/to spread/to transmit/to infect/to transfer/to circulate/to conduct (electricity)
to pass on errors or lies (idiom); the propagation of misconceptions
widely praised (idiom); with an extensive public reputation

sentences.english: A moving legend was often told around the area of Zhongxian County, Sichuan Province.
sentences.chinese: 在四川忠县一带，则流传着一则感人肺腑的传说。

sentences.english: But there also have some Warring States Period documents in the spreading process sometimes.
sentences.chinese: 但在流传过程中也间杂有一些战国史料。

sentences.english: Unfortunately, however, of great luck, it's been non-circulating Rubbings .
sentences.chinese: 然而不幸中的大幸是，它的拓本一直在民间流传。

sentences.english: The world urgently needs the ancient wisdom of the East.
sentences.chinese: 世界需要流传了数千年之久的东方智慧。

sentences.english: Because the abacus is a daily-use device made from wood, few of them have survived.
sentences.chinese: 因为算盘是一种木质的日常用具，流传下来的很少。

sentences.english: Text 1And yet the myth of controlling the waters persists.
sentences.chinese: 但是，控制洪水的神话还在流传着。

sentences.english: Most of these exclamations have survived from earlier days.
sentences.chinese: 大多数从早期流传下来的感叹词。

sentences.english: Wolf-grandam stories are in the air all aroud the world.
sentences.chinese: 狼外婆故事是广泛流传于世界各地的故事类型。

sentences.english: The third chapter is about the development and spread of late imperial mosaic.
sentences.chinese: 第三章是关于帝国晚期镶嵌画的发展和流传情况。

sentences.english: The wildest rumours were circulating in Berlin last night, adds Reuter.
sentences.chinese: 路透社还称，昨晚在柏林有几个谣言在广泛流传。

sentences.english: Market this year, what year, everyone gossips.
sentences.chinese: 市场今年，哪一年，每个人都流传。

sentences.english: The custom has been held on nowadays.
sentences.chinese: 这个习俗一直流传到现在。

sentences.english: The fourth chapter draws an outline of the influence of Florus.
sentences.chinese: 第四章评述弗罗鲁斯在后世的影响和流传情况。

sentences.english: His dictionaries, too, were wide ranging in their intended audiences and level of scholarliness.
sentences.chinese: 他的字典在其特定的读者和学术界之中广泛流传。

sentences.english: The author has investigated systematically the different versions of "Miscellanies at Banqiao" and their circulation.
sentences.chinese: 本文系统考察了《板桥杂记》的各种刊本与流传过程。

sentences.english: Huineng became a Buddhist sect sixth generation descendants, this story for a long.
sentences.chinese: 慧能成为佛教南宗第六代传人，这故事流传相当久远。

definition: widely spread/widely rumored/stories abound/(sb's exploits are) widely circulated
legend/folklore/to repeat from mouth to mouth/they say that...
among the people/popular/folk/non-governmental/involving people rather than governments
passed on from generation to generation (idiom); to hand down
to get round fast/to spread like wildfire
unfounded rumor/to pass on a mistaken belief to others
